comments.body: Please include the license file by adding `license_file: LICENSE`.
I think the LICENSE is currently missing from the 0.2 package on pypi. Can we update the recipe on the next release with it?
LICENSE file will be added in the next release: https://github.com/danielballan/nbexamples/pull/17

> Can we update the recipe on the next release with it?

Yep, that's fine. Just want to get the ball rolling on this.

comments.body:
Just confirming everyone is ok with being listed as a maintainer.

cc @danielballan @mariusvniekerk @parente

It seems GitHub is now remaining tarball directories from the original format `<tag>.tar.gz` to `<reponame>-<tag>.tar.gz`. So maybe in rolling out these changes they regenerated the archives resulting in updated timestamps and such. This could cause a checksum change.

To confirm nothing malicious has occurred (not that I think it would, but I wanted to be sure). I tried to compare an archive of my own creation. Here are the steps I used to make it.

``` bash
$ git clone https://github.com/danielballan/nbexamples
$ git archive v0.2.0 > nbexamples-v0.2.0.tar.gz
```

After generating this, I downloaded the archive from GitHub. As the binaries of course differ (timestamps), I extracted both into two separate directories and then ran `diff -r`. FWICT there are no differences between the two. Now this doesn't rule out something happening to the repo, but it does verify that the archive can be generated from the repo with no code/binary differences (beyond timestamp changes).

If you wish to be extra sure, someone that cloned/had the repo before this change could repeat the same procedure to determine if there is any difference before and after.

Also, I have emailed GitHub asking for clarification about whether anything changed about GitHub tag archive releases. Will let everyone know what they say.
Thanks for taking such a detailed look at this. That's very generous of you to spend this much time sorting out what might have happened

Well, if you think about it, this issue could be happening with other GitHub repos/tags. So it is better we start getting to the bottom of it right away.

That being said, this was pretty easy to do. ðŸ˜„
In fact, this _is_ happening to other GitHub repos/tags FWICT. So it is worth being aware of this issue.
What a strange decision on the part of github to regenerate archives and change the sha

I'm ok with the change and it does seem to be for the better as it is now `<name>-<tag>.<comp>` as opposed to `<tag>.<comp>`. Though I think it is a bit weird/not nice that they didn't bother to tell anyone about it.
Given this is seeing a wider range of effect, I have [posted](https://gitter.im/conda-forge/conda-forge.github.io?at=57e86336ea1b6b1a6c68ffb0) details on Gitter about this change.
